section.section: In this subtitle the following words have the meanings indicated.
"Commission" means the Maryland Health Care Commission.

"Mandated health insurance service" means a legislative proposal or statute that would require a particular health care service to be provided or offered in a health benefit plan, by a carrier or other organization authorized to provide health benefit plans in the State.

"Mandated health insurance service", as applicable to all carriers, does not include services enumerated to describe a health maintenance organization under § 19-701(g)(2) of the Health - General Article.

text.section: This subtitle does not affect the ability of the General Assembly to enact legislation on mandated health insurance services.

section.section: The Commission shall assess the social, medical, and financial impacts of a proposed mandated health insurance service.

text.section: Subject to the limitations of the State budget, the Commission may contract for actuarial services and other professional services to carry out the provisions of this section.

section.section: On or before December 31, 1998, and each December 31 thereafter, the Commission shall submit a report on its findings, including any recommendations, to the Governor and, subject to § 2-1246 of the State Government Article, the General Assembly.

The annual report prepared by the Commission shall include an evaluation of any mandated health insurance service legislatively proposed or otherwise submitted to the Commission by a member of the General Assembly prior to July 1 of that year.
